intro: Bulbostylis malawiensis, commonly known as the Malawi sedge, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along riverbanks. Bulbostylis malawiensis is often found in shallow water or moist soils, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
